intro: Oceanopapaver neocaledonicum, commonly known as the New Caledonian poppy, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers, which bloom in late summer. The plant has smooth, green leaves and a slender, erect stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
